Another Canadian...yeah that's what we go by, but I get .10 more for heavy haulage
$0.45 for the first 40,000Km, $0.32 for anything over.  I usually do about 60,000Km per year.  Burt
I am unionized,and through our negotiated contract we are 50. cents per km.
52 cents/k

For those of you getting more than the CCRA limits ( $0.52 / km and $0.46 / km after 5,000km) should know that you are required to claim the entire re-imbursement as income.  However, you will be able to deduct your auto expenses.  For those being re-imbursed for the CCRA limits or less, there is no need to report the re-imbursement as income.

I'm one of the lucky ones with a company car (and gas card), but most of our sales force drive their own cars...and boy, are they ever getting hosed compared to most on here:  $0.35/km for the first 2000 km a month and only $0.20/km after that.
